doom.driver: White House presses Iran to make deal, while ramping up military presence. US media reports that Trump has discussed attack options with advisers, and a strike could happen as early as Saturday.
doom.blurb: SATURDAY STRIKE: IRAN IN THE CROSSHAIRS
doom.summary: Trump reportedly eyeing Iran military strikes as early as Saturday while carrier groups mass in the Gulf. Meanwhile, South Korea just sentenced its former president to life in prison for insurrection, Russia and Iran are holding joint naval drills, and the US is building a 5,000-person military base in Gaza. It's a geopolitical pressure cooker with multiple lids rattling.

factors.name: Geopolitics
factors.detail: US discussing potential Iran strikes as early as Saturday with massive naval buildup, while Russia-Iran conduct joint drills and Syria pullout proceeds.

factors.name: Governance
factors.detail: South Korean ex-president sentenced to life for insurrection; Peru's eighth president in a decade takes office; Trump sanctions ICC judges.

factors.name: AI Capability
factors.detail: OpenAI executive warns nations risk becoming 'weaker and poorer' without AI adoption, while India hosts global AI summit with mixed industry signals.

factors.name: Cyber
factors.detail: Kenyan activist's phone cracked with Israeli tech; Chrome zero-day vulnerability actively exploited in the wild; password manager vulnerabilities exposed.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: Mass casualties continue globally: 32 killed in Nigeria village raids, 53 dead/missing in Mediterranean migrant boat capsizing, 30 miners dead from carbon monoxide in Nigeria.

dawn.driver: Scientists at the University of New Hampshire have unleashed artificial intelligence to dramatically speed up the hunt for next-generation magnetic materials.
dawn.blurb: AI BREAKTHROUGH COULD FREE EVs FROM RARE EARTHS
dawn.summary: While headlines focus on geopolitical tensions and algorithmic surveillance, a University of New Hampshire team has deployed AI to accelerate the discovery of next-generation magnets that could replace rare earth materials in electric vehicles. This breakthrough addresses one of clean energy's most persistent supply chain vulnerabilities. Science continues solving tomorrow's problems while the world argues about today's.

factors.name: Science
factors.detail: AI-powered materials discovery could eliminate rare earth dependency in EVs, solving a critical supply chain bottleneck.

factors.name: Cooperation
factors.detail: Global AI summit in India brings together tech leaders despite geopolitical tensions, focusing on open access and collaboration.

factors.name: Human Spirit
factors.detail: Florida man rescues family from submerged SUV, reunites with them one week later to celebrate heroic act.

factors.name: Environment
factors.detail: New sodium-ion battery stores twice the energy while potentially desalinating seawater, offering dual environmental benefits.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: Psychedelic DMT shows promise reducing depression symptoms after single dose in clinical trial, offering new mental health pathway.
